did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, clippings, drafts of articles, legal briefs, business papers and records, subject files, photographs, film.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Legal files pertaining to SCHLEGEL VS U.S., 1961-1969; files relating to PACE! A DIGEST OF SEX AND HUMOR, 1970; subject files on sexual topics in general and homosexual topics in particular; and erotic photographs and other materials.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Gay activist and editor and publisher of gay magazines. Born in Berrysburg, Pennsylvania, February 11, 1927 and died February 25, 2006.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Legal files, 1961-1969, pertaining to Schlegel vs U.S., a court case relating to Schlegel dismissal from U.S. Army employment and 1970 files relating to Pace! A Digest of Sex and Humor, for which Schlegel served as editor and co-publisher, including letters to the editor, business correspondence, and materials concerning the finances and advertising. Also, correspondence, erotic photographs and writing, and information on models collected for possible publication, some of which (when noted) came from John W. Emmerson (born April 23,1920, died April 18,1986) from Battle Creek, Michigan. Also clippings, a subject file, magazines, and books on sexual topics in general and homosexual topics in particular.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 9-10: restricted until 2035. Box 11: restricted until 2030. Boxes 9-10: materials in these boxes may not be reproduced or put online.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Richard L. Schlegel papers, #7306. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
